conference.title: International Conference on Advanced Communications and Computation

organization.summerize: The Fourteenth International Conference on Advanced Communications and Computation (INFOCOMP 2024) is dedicated to academic and industrial achievements and visions in advanced communications and computing, covering a wide range of topics and welcoming academic, research, and industrial contributions. Onsite and online options are available to accommodate a large number of situations.
organization.callForPaper:
INFOCOMP 2024 invites submissions on various aspects of advanced communications and computing, including (but not limited to) the following conference tracks:

*   Trends and advances on architecture/methods
*   Trends and advances on disciplines/applications
*   Large scale and fast computation
*   Programming models
*   Networks/systems communications
*   Networks/systems measurement, control and management
*   Turbulence modeling and simulation
*   Advanced applications
*   Legal context, economic use and re-use
*   Evaluation context
*   Biometry, security, access technologies, algorithms, and applications

Accepted contributions will be published by IARIA Press and archived in the Open Access IARIA ThinkMind Digital Library. Authors of selected papers will be invited to submit extended versions to an IARIA Journal.

conference.title: IEEE International Conference on Computer Communications

organization.summerize: IEEE INFOCOM 2025, scheduled to take place in London, United Kingdom, is a top-ranked networking conference of the IEEE Communications Society. The event aims to foster an immersive conference experience, while also considering remote presentation options for authors facing travel difficulties. It solicits research papers describing innovative research contributions to computer and data communication networks.
organization.callForPaper:
IEEE INFOCOM 2025 invites submissions of research papers describing significant and innovative contributions to the field of computer and data communication networks. Papers must be written in English, with a maximum length of 10 printed pages. Key dates include:

*   **Abstract Due:** Wednesday, July 24, 2024 (11:59pm, PDT)
*   **Full Paper Due:** Wednesday, July 31, 2024 (11:59pm, PDT)
*   **Notification of Acceptance:** Friday, December 6, 2024

Topics of interest span both theoretical and systems research and include, but are not limited to, artificial intelligence/machine learning for networking, cellular wireless broadband systems, cyber-physical network systems, datacenter networking, edge and fog computing/networking, green networks, the Internet of Things, network security and privacy, quantum networking, software-defined networking (SDN), vehicular networks, and web applications and content distribution. IEEE INFOCOM incorporates a rigorous double-blind review process.
topics: Radio Frequency Identification (RFID) and Near-Field Communication (NFC)

conference.title: Association for Computer-Aided Architectural Design Research in Asia (CAADRIA) annual conference

organization.summerize: CAADRIA 2025, themed 'Architectural Informatics,' will be held in Tokyo from March 22-29, 2025. It explores the intersection of architecture and information technology, viewing cities as information systems. The conference features keynote speeches, paper presentations, workshops, and a post-conference tour.
organization.callForPaper:
CAADRIA 2025 invites original, high-quality papers presenting current computer-aided architectural design research, including topics such as:

*   Artificial intelligence, neural networks, and machine learning
*   Building Information Modeling (BIM) and City Information Modeling (CIM)
*   Collective, collaborative & interdisciplinary design
*   Computational design research & education
*   Design cognition and human-computer interaction
*   Disrupted practices, resilience, and social sustainability
*   Environmental and ecological performance
*   Generative, algorithmic & evolutionary design
*   Digital Heritage
*   Interactive environments
*   Material systems, processes, and assembly
*   Practice-based design research
*   Robotics, digital fabrication, and construction
*   Simulation, visualisation, and impact projection
*   Theory, philosophy & methodology of computational design research
*   Urban analytics, big data analysis, and smart cities
*   AR / VR / XR
*   Application of technology in the context of the Asia-Pacific Region

Key dates include an abstract submission deadline of August 27, 2024, and a full paper submission deadline of November 24, 2024. The proceedings are double-blind peer reviewed and require in person presentation for publication.
topics: philosophy & methodology of computational design research
big data analysis and smart cities
Application of technology in the context of the Asia-Pacific Region

dates.name: Student Review of Architectural Informatics Society
Deadline for WS application for participants

conference.title: ACM SIGMOD-SIGACT-SIGART Conference on Principles of Database Systems

organization.summerize: The ACM SIGMOD/PODS Conference is a leading international forum for database researchers, practitioners, developers, and users. The 2025 conference will be held in Berlin, Germany, from June 22-27, 2025. It aims to explore cutting-edge ideas and results and to exchange techniques, tools, and experiences.
organization.callForPaper:
PODS 2025 invites scientific articles that present principled contributions to modeling, application, and system building in data management. Key aspects include:

*   **Scope:** Encompasses theoretical results, new concepts and frameworks, experimental work, and rigorous analysis of industry artifacts.
*   **Topics:** Includes database processing, design, access, data quality, data analysis, uncertainty, interoperability, responsible data management, human-database interaction, and connections between database principles and other disciplines.
*   **Submission Format:**
    *   Use the standard ACM \"acmsmall\" proceedings stylesheet.
    *   Maximum length: 15 pages, not including references.
    *   Double-anonymous reviewing policy.
*   **Submission Site:** [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=pods2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=pods2025)
*   **Publication:** Accepted papers will be published in a PODS 2025 issue of the PACMMOD journal.
*   **Important Dates:** There are two submission phases with deadlines for abstract, submission, rebuttal, initial notification, revision submission and final notification.

conference.title: ACIS Conference on Software Engineering Research, Management and Applications

organization.summerize: The 23rd IEEE/ACIS International Conference on Software Engineering, Management and Applications (SERA 2025) brings together researchers, scientists, engineers, industry practitioners, and students to discuss, encourage and exchange new ideas, research results, and experiences on all aspects of Software Engineering, Management and Applications. SERA 2025 will be held at UNLV Campus in Las Vegas, USA.
organization.callForPaper:
SERA 2025 invites submissions to discuss new ideas, research results, and experiences on all aspects of Software Engineering, Management and Applications.

*   **Submission Deadline:** March 28, 2025 (extended)
*   **Acceptance Notification (papers submitted by March 14):** April 4, 2025
*   **Acceptance Notification (Papers submitted after March 14):** April 11, 2025
*   **Camera Ready Papers/Registration:** April 18, 2025
*   **Workshop/Special Session Proposal:** January 10, 2025

SERA 2025 aims to facilitate cross-fertilizations among key technology enabling areas.

location.address: UNLV Campus, Las Vegas, Nevada, USA

conference.title: ACM Int'l Symposium on Field Programmable Gate Arrays

organization.summerize: The ACM/SIGDA International Symposium on Field-Programmable Gate Arrays (ISFPGA) is a premier conference for the presentation of advances in FPGA technology. In 2025, the 33rd edition of ISFPGA will be held in Monterey, California, USA. Accepted papers will be published in the conference proceedings and available in the ACM Digital Library.
organization.callForPaper:
ISFPGA 2025 invites submissions related to advances in FPGA technology. Key details include:

*   **Submission Deadlines (AoE):**
    *   Abstracts Due: October 1, 2024
    *   Submissions Due: October 8, 2024
*   **Topics of Interest:** The conference seeks research papers related to a wide range of topics:
    *   FPGA Architecture
    *   FPGA Circuit Design
    *   CAD for FPGAs
    *   High-Level Abstractions and Tools for FPGAs
    *   FPGA-based and FPGA-like Computing Engines
    *   Applications and Design Studies
    *   AI/ML for and on FPGAs
*   **Submission Guidelines:**
    *   Papers should use the sigconf ACM format template.
    *   Submissions will be considered for acceptance as regular (10 pages max, excluding references) or short papers (6 pages max, excluding references).
    *   The FPGA Symposium uses a double-blind reviewing system.
*   **Artifact Evaluation:** The conference will allow authors to submit accompanying artifacts for their paper submissions for evaluation.
*   **Double Blind Policy:** The FPGA Symposium uses a double-blind reviewing system. Manuscripts must not identify authors or their affiliations
topics: High-Level Abstractions and Tools for FPGAs

conference.title: Architectural Support for Programming Languages and Operating Systems

organization.summerize: ASPLOS (ACM International Conference on Architectural Support for Programming Languages and Operating Systems) is a premier academic forum for multidisciplinary computer systems research. ASPLOS 2025 will be held in Rotterdam, The Netherlands, from March 30 to April 3, 2025, co-located with EuroSys 2025. It has three submission deadlines: spring, summer, and fall.
organization.callForPaper:
ASPLOS 2025 invites original, high-quality research submissions related to computer architecture, programming languages, operating systems, and associated areas. Key aspects of the call include:

*   **Areas of Interest:** Encompasses existing, emerging, and non-traditional compute platforms, heterogeneous architectures, cloud computing, memory, storage, networking, security, virtualization, and systems for big data and machine learning.
*   **Submission Cycles:** Spring, Summer, and Fall deadlines to encourage timely submission of ready papers.
*   **Double-Blind Review:** ASPLOS employs a double-blind review process, and submissions should be carefully anonymized.
*   **Artifact Evaluation:** Authors are encouraged to submit artifacts to support reproducibility.
*   **Major Revisions:** A “Major Revision” decision may be offered, allowing authors to revise and resubmit their work for a second review.

conference.title: ACM SIGUCCS Conference on User Services

organization.summerize: The SIGUCCS Annual Conference 2025 will be held in Denver from April 6-9, 2025. This conference is a great opportunity for networking with other higher education technology professionals, learning new skills, and discussing trends. Attendees can expand their professional network and form new connections.
organization.callForPaper:
SIGUCCS 2025 invites proposals for a variety of session formats, including:

*   **SIGUCCS Academy:** Structured and interactive sessions tailored for learning useful skills in Customer Service, Student Employee Management, or Project Management.
*   **Presentation:** Standard presentation format with an opportunity for questions and answers (60 minutes total).
*   **Panel:** Presenters from multiple schools offer insights and lead discussions on a specific topic of interest (60 minutes total).
*   **Poster:** Authors present their topics in poster format and answer questions in a one-on-one setting.
*   **Lightning Talks:** Group presentation format where each member of a small group is allocated 7 minutes for a concise presentation on a specific topic.

conference.title: International Workshop on Developments in Computational Models
International Conference on Ambient Systems, Networks and Technologies

organization.summerize: The 14th International Workshop on Agent-based Mobility, Traffic and Transportation Models (ABMTRANS-2025) will be held in conjunction with the 16th International Conference on Ambient Systems, Networks and Technologies (ANT-2025) in Patras, Greece, from April 22nd to 24th, 2025. ABMTrans provides a multidisciplinary forum for researchers and practitioners to present new research results and novel ideas related to agent-based traffic and transportation modeling.
organization.callForPaper:
ABMTrans 2025 invites submissions presenting new research results and novel ideas related to the theory or practice of agent-based traffic and transportation modeling. Topics of interest include but are not limited to:

*   Agent-based modeling and simulation
*   Agent-human interactions
*   Environment modeling and interaction protocols
*   Data mining, learning, and adaptation
*   Marketing decision support
*   Collaboration, cooperation, competition, coalitions in traffic and transportation models

Accepted papers will be published by Elsevier Science in the open-access Procedia Computer Science series on-line and indexed by Scopus and by Thomson Reuters' Conference Proceeding Citation Index.

organization.summerize: The ACM-SIAM Symposium on Discrete Algorithms (SODA) focuses on research related to the design and analysis of efficient algorithms and data structures for discrete problems. SODA24 took place in Alexandria, Virginia, from January 7-10, 2024. The scope includes theoretical analysis, as well as experimental validation, and the mathematical problems related to their development or limitations.
organization.callForPaper: SODA focuses on research topics related to design and analysis of efficient algorithms and data structures for discrete problems. The scope includes theoretical analysis, as well as experimental validation, and the mathematical problems related to their development or limitations. Papers that raise important algorithmic problems that can benefit from theoretical investigation and analysis, are encouraged.

conference.title: International Workshop on the Web and Databases
International Symposium on Intelligent and Interactive Multimedia: Systems and Services
International Workshop on Coding and Cryptography
AAAI Conference on Human Computation and Crowdsourcing

organization.summerize: The 12th AAAI Conference on Human Computation and Crowdsourcing (HCOMP 2024) will be held October 16-19th in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, focusing on ''Responsible Crowd Work for Better AI.'' HCOMP is the premier venue for disseminating research findings on human computation and crowdsourcing, promoting interdisciplinary research and dialogue across disciplines and communities of practice. HCOMP 2024 is colocated with ACM UIST 2024 (October 13-16, 2024).
organization.callForPaper: HCOMP 2024 calls for papers, specifically focusing on human computation and crowdsourcing. The conference promotes interdisciplinary research, and encourages the exchange of advances in human computation and crowdsourcing not only among researchers but also engineers and practitioners to encourage dialogue across disciplines and communities of practice. The conference covers AI and HCI, human-centered qualitative studies and HCI design, social computing, artificial intelligence economics, computational social science, digital humanities, policy, and ethics.
